AMBOS SE ESFUERZAN CON SUS EMPLEOS PARA PODERLE BRINDAR A SU HIJO LO MEJRO QUE SE PUEDA EL ESTA ESTUDIANDO LA SECUNDARIA Y ELLOS DESEA PODER SEGUIRLO PAOYANDO HASTA QUE CONCLUYA SUS ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS.
texts.en: This borrower worked for a factory, but right now she is disabled due to the constant, repetitive work. One of her tendons required surgery but in two weeks, she will be recovered and return to work. Her husband worked as an independent bricklayer in Laredo, Texas on and off. Both of them work at their jobs to be able to offer their son the best possible. He is in junior high school and they want to keep supporting him until he finishes the university.

loans.use: to start construction on a laundry room.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Moeun is a 56-year-old mother of six children living in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Cambodia. Out of her six children, she has three sons whose ages are over eighteen years, two of them are still in school, and the other helps support the family’s business. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland for almost thirty-five years, and her husband supplements the family’s income by making palm juice. The current business earns her about 27,400 KHR per day. The main challenge for her is the small income earned to support her children’s education until graduation. 

This is the first microloan for Moeun’s group of two with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Moeun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a piglet as additional income. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy carismática y trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su pareja, John de 30 años, y sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace 7 años trabaja de forma independiente y está muy agradecida con Dios por darle esa oportunidad. Tiene un puesto donde vende ropa para todo tipo de personas, reconoce que esta labor la está beneficiando, pues sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito radica en la calidad y el precio de sus prendas. Con el tiempo piensa establecerse en su casa que ahora está en proceso de construcción, gracias a sus ahorros y las ganancias de su trabajo; allí podrá vender con mayor rapidez y comodidad.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP, pues conoció de esta microfinanciera desde que inició su negocio. Agradece la confianza de facilitarle este préstamo y asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, como en anteriores créditos. 
Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará más prendas de vestir para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Yovana is a charismatic, hardworking, twenty-six year old woman.  She lives in a rented house with her partner, thirty year old John, and her three children and wants to provide her family with a better quality of life.  

She has been working independently for seven years and is very thankful to God for giving her this opportunity.  She has a stall where she sells clothing for all types of people.  She recognizes that this work is benefitting her as her sales have increased with the passage of time.  The key to her success lies in the quality and price of her clothing.  Her home is presently under construction, thanks to her savings and profits from her business.  Eventually, she plans to establish the business in her home as she will be able to make sales more quickly and comfortably there.

This is her 14th loan with MFP so she has known about this microfinance institution since she started her business.  Yovana is grateful for the trust in providing this loan and promises to be punctual with her payments, as in previous loans.  She will use the loan to purchase more clothing for children and adults.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to contunue selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, está aumentando la variedad de sus productos en ropa y calzado, para esto necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo que le de los recursos económicos necesarios para la compra de calzado para damas de diferentes estilos y ropa en variedad de blusas, faldas, ropa interior, entre otras mercaderías que sea necesaria y que le dé una buena y mejor vistosidad al negocio.

Ella considera que está mejorando su calidad en el inventario del negocio, creciendo cada vez más en el mercado y teniendo mayor oportunidad de venta, en su familia sus condiciones económicas han mejorado pues cuenta con una fuente de ingreso un poco más estable a la que anteriormente tenían.
texts.en:
María wants to increase the variety of clothes and shoes she sells, and she needs to request a new loan providing her with the necessary economic resources to buy women shoes in different styles and a variety of clothes such as blouses, skirts, underwear and other products she might need to give a better and more colorful outlook to her shop.

She thinks she is improving the quality of her inventory, that she is growing more each day in the market and that she is having more sales opportunities. The economic conditions of her family have improved because the source of income they can now count on is more stable than the one they could previously rely on.

loans.use: To buy shoes, blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Ing's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Kror Kor district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Ing is aged 37 and widowed. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her six children by farming rice on one hectare of farmland, selling Khmer noodles in the village, and raising pigs on the site. Out of her six children, three are dependents and still in school. Having been in the business for several years, the current business earns her approximately 11,600KHR per day. 

Ing has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle, and she completely paid back the loan while her group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The first loan has helped her to afford a pig and buy a small plot of farmland. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy feed for her pig. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, age 42, lives with her family in a peaceful village in the Baray district of the Kompong Tom province. She is married to a local farmer and has four  children, all of whom attend school. Sok and her spouse help each other in maintaining a farming business to raise their children and provide them with a good education in the future. 

Sok grows various kinds of crops such as rice, potatoes and beans. She has been doing this business since her parents handed it to her. She generates around KHR 14,600 per day.

Recently, Sok is busy working on her rice and potato field. She really needs a few laborers to help her. For this reason, Sok would like to take out a loan in the sum of KHR 4,500,000 to pay laborers to transplant her rice and remove unwanted plants as well as rent a tractor to till the land for growing her potatoes.

Sok says that although she doesn’t have enough capital, she has the discipline and patience to achieve her goals in life. She is very thankful for the given funds, which will go a long way toward providing success for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers to transplant her rice and remove unwanted plants as well as rent a tractor to till the land for growing her potatoes.

loans.name: Adjélé

texts.fr: Jeune dame active de 32ans, madame Adjélé est maman d’un adorable enfant de 11mois. Elle est secrétaire et revendeuse en même temps de pagnes, bijoux, mèches il y a 12ans. Elle le fait de façon ambulante et à domicile. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son cinquième cycle de prêt. Ce montant lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut éduquer et scolariser son enfant au coté de son mari qui est comptable et agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Adjélé, age 32, is a young mother of an adorable 11-month-old child. She is a secretary and has been a reseller of pagnes, jewelry, and hair extensions for 12 years. She conducts her sales door-to-door and from her home.

She is a long-time client of WAGES currently on her fifth loan cycle. This new credit will allow her to stock up on merchandise to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her goal is to provide for her child’s education and schooling together with her husband, an accountant. She also wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, jewelry, and hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, age 49, who is a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Hilario, a laborer, and is a mother to her three children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Hilda operates a dried-fish retailing business. She buys dried fish from wholesalers, repacks them and then sells them per pack for a profit. Products can range from dried fish to dried anchovies and other similar products. Customers are attracted to her business due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Hilda is requesting a PHP 33,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Hilda dreams of having a good future. Her hope is that her children will finish their education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
This is Jenneth. She previously accessed a loan of 13,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities of a variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 18,000 PHP for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jenneth dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase variety store inventory.

loans.name: Nyamlkhagva

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamlkhagva, 43 is a skilful, experienced railroader. Since 1991 he has been working as a railway man, but his monthly salary does not usually meet with his family's necessities. However he enjoys his job and his duties. He lives with his wife, 41, and his daughter in his old house which is located in the slum district in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.

Since his house was built, it has not been renovated. Every winter his family faces one big problem, that is of heat loss trough the wall and floor since the house is so old and not updated. It is detrimental to his family, harmful to their health and costly due to the fuel expenses. Therefore he has decided to insulate his house wall. Insulating the house needs foam, cement and other building materials.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit a lot of pollution every night, from families just trying to stay warm. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on the natural gas. The loan he is taking will be used to buy insulation materials to insulate his house walls to prevent heat loss.

loans.use: To buy some insulation materials to insulate his house walls.

loans.name: Wendi

texts.es:
Wendi tiene 64 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora y alegre. Su esposo, el padre de su hija murió y actualmente vive con otra pareja, su hija y su nieto, a quien quiere mucho. Su casa es propia, la que compró con la ayuda de su difunto esposo.
Su actividad es la venta de almuerzos, tales como arroz chaufa, pollos fritos,  asados de pollo y otros platillos que sabe preparar. Cuenta con dos mesas y algunas sillas que instala en el frontis de su casa, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su hija. También vende gaseosas y golosinas, para ello cuenta con una exhibidora donde guarda estas bebidas a la temperatura que les agrada a sus clientes por lo caluroso de la región. Inició hace más de 6 años y lo que le gusta es que puede contar con un ingreso económico, además de estar en la comodidad de su casa, se siente una persona productiva y le distrae. Por otro lado, tiene una regular clientela, la que se supo ganar con el trascuerdo del tiempo.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito que tuvo.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de platillos; como arroz, aceites, pollos, carnes, verduras y otros. Así como bebidas y golosinas al por mayor, buscando conseguir menores precios para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Wendi is happy, enterprising, 64 year old woman.  Her husband, the father of her daughter, died and now she lives with another partner, her daughter, and her granddaughter, who she loves very much.  She owns her home, which she bought with her deceased husband’s help.

She is in the business of selling lunches such as “arroz chaufa” (Chinese fried rice), roasted chicken, and other dishes that she knows how to prepare.  She has two tables and some chairs set up in front of her home.  Her daughter helps her in the business.  She also sells soda and candy, and has a display case where she keeps the beverages at a pleasing temperature for her customers as the region is very warm. She started her business more than six years ago and she likes having the income and working in the comfort of her home.  She feels productive and it amuses her.  In addition, she has regular customers that she has managed to gain over time.  

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has their financial support as this enables her to feel confident in continuing her business.  She promises, once again, to make her payments on time, as with the previous loan she had.  She will invest the 2000 nuevos soles she is requesting in the purchase of supplies and ingredients for the preparation of her dishes; rice, oil, chicken, meat, vegetables, and other items.  In addition, she will purchase wholesale soda and candy at lower prices to obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
Abdurasul is young and strong-minded. He is very intelligent and works very hard at improving his living. He has  his own business for more than two years. He sells mobile telephones and notebook computers. He is persistent and has many customers. His business has developing day by day. 

Abdurasul has a lovely wife and a smart child.  He loves his wife and child very much. His wife doesn’t have a job, and that’s why Abdurasul must comfort his family with all the necessary things alone. 

He wants to buy mobile telephone and notebook computers for developing his business.  You are the only one who can help him. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy moblie phones and notebook computers for developing his business.

loans.name: Edina Kiden

texts.en:
Edina Kiden is 30 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She lives in Juba and runs a food store, which she has been doing for two years.
 
Edina Kiden is requesting a loan for 500 SDG, which she will use to purchase dodo (leafy greens), oranges, onions, and other food items. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She has no other source of income.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.  In the future, Edina Kiden would like to expand her  business.

loans.use: to purchase dodo (leafy greens), oranges, onions, and other food items.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is married and lives with his parents.  Nine years ago Abdurahmon began his own business selling vegetables. He buys vegetables from other regions and sells to local people.  He has many customers because his prices are low. His wife helps him with the business. 

Abdurahmon is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy vegetables for the new season.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for the new season.

loans.name: Ahlimba

texts.fr: Madame Ahlimba est âgée de 44ans. Elle est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place et ont ensemble 02 enfants qui fréquentent. Ils sont âgés de 19 et 07ans. Elle est revendeuse de profession et cela depuis 1991. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes et de kom « une nourriture préparée à base de maïs qui se mange avec de la tomate fraiche et du poisson et cela très appréciée par la population togolaise ». Ses enfants l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité qu’elle même à domicile et de façon ambulante. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour s’approvisionner en pagnes et en maïs. Elle voudrait à l’avenir renforcer son activité et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ahlimba is 44 years old. Her husband works for a local company, and they have two children aged 7 and 19 who both go to school. 

She has been a reseller since 1991. Her income-generating activity is the sale of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and “kom”, a maize-based dish served with fish and fresh tomatoes that is well liked by the people of Togo. She works door-to-door and from her home, with the help of her children. 

This is her second loan cycle with WAGES, and she will use this credit to stock up on pagnes and maize. 

She wants to strengthen her activity and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and maize.

loans.name: Janeth Amparo

texts.es:
Janeth, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita realizar la compra de materia prima para el negocio de las tortillas, se comprara 10 sacos de maíz, y unas cargas de leña, pues esto le permitirá la producción de tortillas para un largo tiempo y la obtención de los precios de estos productos a un costo menor.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar la venta de las tortillas, ya que tenía a la mano los recursos necesarios para aumentar su producción y poder mejorar las ventas a los clientes, sus condiciones en el negocio están mejorando y está proveyendo mejores ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Janeth is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy basic ingredients to prepare tortillas, in order to obtain these products at a lower price. She will buy 10 sacks of corn and some loads of firewood, as this will help her producing tortillas for a long time.

The previous loan has helped her improving her tortillas sale, as she has been able to keep at hand all the necessary means to increase her production, and she has succeeded in improving the sale rate to her customers. The conditions of her shop are improving and she is earning a better income to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of corn and some loads of firewood.

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sampov Meas district, Souy is 47 years old and married. She has eight children.  Four of them are staying with the family, working as construction workers or going to school. 

Souy is a rice farmer of three hectares of farmland, while her husband is a construction worker. Having been in this business for almost 30 years, she currently can earn about KHR 12,900 per day. 

This is a microloan for Souy’s group of three, and this is her second loan. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy chickens to raise for sale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer in Nkubu area of central Kenya. She is married with three children, who are 10, 12, and 31 years old. She has 15 years in active farming, selling her produce to the local market. Her farm is run with the help of one farmhand.

Alice has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to use in buying poultry.. She says the new venture has good prospects because of high demand for eggs and birds in the local market and additionally the ability of the production to run throughout the year. She reiterates that her business will improve, including her dairy business.

Alice notes the lack of adequate feeds as her major challenge and more specifically with dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise as an addition to her farming.

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
This is Florenia.  She is 67 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband passed away, leaving her with three children, who are working already. She manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Florenia operates a junk shop.  Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines.  While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Florenia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will add the money to her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from trash scavengers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florenia hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable trash to process and sell to manufacturers.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Say is a farmer who owns approximately three hectares of farm land on which she grows various kinds of crops, including rice and potatoes. To supplement the income from the farm, she raises pigs for fattening and sells them to local butchers. She is able to help her husband earn household income, so that they are able to provide food, medicines, education, and basic living needs for their children. 

Say wants to improve her business and upgrade her living conditions. She is requesting a loan from HKL, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for transportation for the family. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy feed for her pigs. Say hopes that she is able to improve her living conditions through the positive impact of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

Patrick started out as a merchant over a year ago. He began with some money he’d saved working as an employee in a retail shop for several years. He now has a large clientele in the community because of his good service and the variety of products he offers in his store.

He’s asking for a loan to buy shoes to stock the store and to provide a wider variety for his customers.

loans.use: to buy bundles of shoes for resale

loans.name: Tito Cosme

texts.fr: Tito Cosme est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Tito Cosme a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et est marié à une marchande du nom de Élisabeth. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Certains des enfants de Tito Cosme sont scolarisés. Tito Cosme vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différents besoins du ménage. Tito Cosme a appris la couture, activité qu’il exerce depuis une dizaine d’année dans son atelier et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Tito Cosme devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Tito Cosme désire acquérir de nouvelles machines. Tito Cosme s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Tito Cosme sollicite une quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Tito Cosme is 32 years old and lives in Benin. He attended primary school. He is married to a merchant named Elisabeth, and the couple have four dependent children, three of them being their own. Some of the children go to school. Tito Cosme lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Tito Cosme learned the trade of sewing. He has been practicing this activity for about ten years in his shop, and he earns substantial income. His customer base is growing steadily. 

To upgrade his activity and become more competitive in the market, Tito Cosme wishes to acquire new sewing machines. He buys his supplies locally. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase his revenue, Tito Cosme is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the fourth time. All three past loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun is 35 years old and lives in a rural village in the Kror Kor district. She is married with six children, two of whom are still in school. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming, which she and her husband have been doing for several years to earn a living. 

Hun’s group consists of three members. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She’s successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she can earn about 22,000 KHR per day. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Hun will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy gasoline for a water pump to carry water into the rice field. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ulziisaikhan

texts.en:
Ulziisaikhan, 29, leases her apartment for $300 a month. Now she lives with her family on her small plot of land in a house that she bought in the Ger district. This area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, has no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. 

Since she bought her house, it has not had any repairs or renovation. Mainly it has heat-loss through the walls. She and her family members always feel cold and get sick in winter due to the cold. 

Also, she pays too much for coal to warm her home in winter, so she decided to insulate and to add on one more small room. She believes her home will be warmer after this, and she will pay less for fuel. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying the necessary building materials to repair her bad house.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials to repair her bad house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking 60-year-old woman who is married. She does catering to earn a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and has two employees. 

She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice for her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba de 56 años de edad es una mujer casada que vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 27 a 34 años. Allí practica una actividad comercial que le ha permitido generar ingresos que aumentan el bienestar de su hogar, porque vende calzado que trae desde Bucaramanga, una ciudad de Colombia reconocida por  la excelencia en su trabajo en cuero, materia prima del cual elaboran hermosos calzados, bolsos y artículos útiles para  damas caballeros e infantil, que generan una imagen de buen gusto y  distinción. Elba además vende multiusos en tela, cuero, madera entre otros, productos que usualmente son comprados principalmente por las amas de casa de las familias, quienes son los principales clientes de ella.  Elba realiza sus ventas a créditos pactados con sus clientes, de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago y esto es lo que hace que la inversión rote rápidamente,  así como también que su creciente clientela aumente . En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado masculino, pues tiene un importante pedido, al que debe responder con efectividad y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para ser oportuna con esta demanda, pues debe esperar los pagos que hacen sus clientes a los cuales vende a crédito, para poder responderles y aumentar  el volumen de sus ventas. Mientras Elba trabaja por lograr sus metas, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 10%, una liquidez del 31,8 y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 45 días, indicadores desde los cuales proyectamos el crecimiento de su negocio y auguramos éxitos en la inversión de su credikiva.
texts.en: Elba is 56 years old. She is married and lives in the town of Soledad with her husband. They have three children between the ages of 27 and 34. The income from her business has allowed her to improve her family's living conditions. She sells shoes that she transports from Bucaramanga, a city in Colombia known for its high-quality leather goods. The leather is used to make beautiful shoes, bags, and accessories for women, men, and children. They are distinguished in appearance and in excellent taste. Elba also sells a variety of goods in cloth, leather, wood, and other materials; these are mainly purchased by the housewives who make up the majority of her customers. Elba sells her merchandise on credit, drawing up agreements with her customers according to their ability to pay. Her willingness to give credit means that her stock rotates rapidly and her customer base continues to grow. She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva, financed through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy men's shoes, since she has a large order that she'd like to meet but lacks the working capital to fill it. She must wait for her credit customers to make their payments in order to fill the order and increase her sales volume. As Elba works toward her goals, she has profits of at least 10%, liquidity of 31.8 to 1, and turnover of receivables of 45 days. All of these indicators suggest that her business will continue to grow, and we predict that her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes.

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enkhtuvshin, 36, is unmarried, and she lives with her two children in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. (A ger is a traditional Mongolian nomadic yurt, and most households are located in the ger district in Ulaanbaatar.) 

Enkhtuvshin runs a stall in the shopping mall. She sells casual clothes and spare parts for mobiles phones. She has been running her business since 2007. There are few clothing shops near her stall, and she has many loyal customers. Before, she used to sell cosmetics in the mall. Actually, she is a math teacher. She was employed for a long time before she started her current business. 

Now her business is the main income source of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes and mobile phone spare parts to increase her stock and sales volume. In addition she has a plan to turn her business into a small clothing shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and mobile phone spare parts to increase her stock and sales volume.

loans.name: Minerva Alicia

texts.es:
LA SRA MINERVA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA, ELLA ES DIVORCIADA DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS, TIENE EL APOYO DE SUS HIJOS QUE YA NO SE ENCUENTRAN VIVIENDO AHÍ.  LA  SEÑORA  MINERVA DESEA MEJORAR  SU CASA YA QUE EN TECHO QUE ACTUALMENTE TIENE ES DE LAMINA I MADREA
CADA VEZ QUE LLEUEVE SE TRANSMINA ÇDAÑANDOSE ASI SUS BIENES MATERIALES
QUE CONTANTO ESFUERZO A PODIDO ADQUIRIR
POR ELLO LA SEÑORA QUIERE PONER LA LOZA DE CONCRETO YA QUE ESTA SU TECHO EN PESIMAS CONDICIONES
QUEDANDO ELLA EN TRANQUILIDAD YAQUE NO SOLO SU TECHO ESTA EN MALAS
C0NDICIONES SI NO QUE ES UN PUNTO DE RIESGO PARA LA SEÑORA
ASI QUEDANDO EN TRANQUILIDAD Y MEJORANDO SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Minerva works as a housekeeper. She has been divorced for many years, and has the support of her children who no longer live at home. Minerva wants to improve her home since her current roof is made of corrugated metal and wood. Every time it rains, the water seeps through and causes damage to the good material that she has purchased.

Therefore, Minerva wants to use a concrete slab since her roof is in terrible condition. It will give Minerva peace of mind because the problem is not only the roof in bad condition, but it is also dangerous. Therefore, repairing the roof will make her happy and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a concrete slab

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 60-year-old married woman. She has five children ranging from 28 years to 38 years. She describes herself as an ambitious and honest woman. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located within a busy market, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She says her biggest business challenge is an insufficient stock of clothes to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her goal is to expand her business into other major markets in Nairobi within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to diversify her business to include selling children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lukande Lemi

texts.en:
Lukande is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 3  and 15.  Four of them go to school. 

Lukande runs a general store.  He has been in business for four years.  He has no employees.  He heard about Finance Sudan through other borrowers.  He is taking a loan of SDG 1,500 to purchase soda, juice, and many other items for his store.  It is his only source of income.

In five years Lukande would like to open a big shop.  His  major challenges include high prices in the market.

Lukande says he is grateful for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy items like soda, soap, and juice for his store.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is fifty-seven years old and single with five children. She been selling sweaters for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to add more sweaters for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy new stock and ensure that the business is stable. 

She hopes to grow her business and give her children a better education in future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  sweaters for sale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus has been separated for three years. He lives in Kisauni. Justus has been a merchant for more than ten years. He sells clothes in a stand in Kisauni. He has a large clientele because he’s situated in a spot that’s visited by many locals. Thanks to this activity he’s been able to educate his children who today are all adults. He’s able to support his household and cover necessary expenses. He asks for the loan to buy more underwear for men to stock his stand which will be of much help to him.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear for men.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 28 years old and has four children. He is a livestock trader, which he has been doing for six years.  He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

James is requesting his first loan for 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more livestock such as sheep and goats to rear and sell at a profit.  The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dream is to improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell.

loans.name: Clement Amule

texts.en:
Clement a 30-year-old  businessman, lives in Juba. He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 7, who go to school. 
Clement runs a general store and has been in business for three years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is requesting a loan of  500 SDG to purchase soda, juice, cosmetics, rice and other items to sell   Clement has no other source of income.

In five years, Clement would like to open a big shop. His major challenges include high prices in the market. Clement says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy soda, cosmetics, rice, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje is from Kisauni. He is married and has three children who attend school. Mwahanje earns his living selling household consumables and says that he has good customers. He also has a small store where he sells milk products.

Mwahanje is a hardworking person who has been an excellent client of Yehu Microfinance, always paying his dues promptly. He is now seeking help to buy drinks, food items, canned goods, bulk items etc. as stock for his store. He doesn’t want to remain without these products in stock. Mwahanje is grateful for this opportunity for a loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food items, canned goods, and bulk items for his business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson sells men's and women's suits and also operates a retail shop to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya of 20,000 KES which helped him to boost his business. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy cereals and polythene bags for resale.

loans.use: to buy cereals and polythene bags.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a conscientious man and that’s why he works hard from early morning till late evening. Hasan always works hard in his business because he wants to be a successful businessman. Seven years ago he began his own business with animal husbandry. Now, he has additional income from cooking shashlik (meat on a spit). He cooks it very tasty and has many customers. 

Hasan has a lovely wife and a smart child. His wife is a teacher and tries to help her husband in all his business. Hasan wants to develop his business further and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy cattle. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Kanisius

texts.en:
Kanisius is 34 years old and is married to Erwina, who is 32. They are blessed with four children, namely: Asti, 15, studying at the 3rd grade of junior high school; Hesty, 13, studying at the 1st grade of junior high school; Randa, 9, studying at the 4th grade of elementary school; and Cissa, 2. 

Kanisius owns a repair shop business. He has been engaged in the business since 2001. From the business, he is able to generate money to meet his family's needs and his children's schooling fees.

Kanisius is thinking of improving his business by adding more spare parts and initiating a kiosk business for his wife. To do so, Kanisius went to the TLM office and requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He would like to spend the loan on spark plugs, inner tubes, and other spare parts as well as to provide daily necessities for his wife to sell. He believes that the loan will support him in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, inner tubes, and other spare parts and also to provide daily neccesities for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Kisinyinye

texts.en:
Kisinyunye is 25 years old, married to Konana and supports a family of five members. She is  a mixed farmer and she has been in the business for the last eight years. Her monthly income is KES 15,000.

She is currently servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to prepare the land and buy farm inputs. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to prepare land and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora, alegre y deseosa de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijas, ahora sólo vive con ellas (Joelia de 20 años y María de 9 años), a las que quiere mucho. Su casa es propia, la compró con el apoyo de su ex pareja.

Su actividad es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Con sus ahorros logró comprar su primera máquina de coser, iniciándose de esa manera en este oficio hace 15 años. Pero no lo realiza de manera continua, pues también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza que compra por catálogo y los vende a sus amistades, en este negocio lleva más de 30 años. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que cuenta con un ingreso económico con el cual  puede pagar los gastos del hogar, estar ocupada y sentirse una mujer productiva. Le gustaría poder ampliar su negocio e instalar otras máquinas, además de poner una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de belleza.

Este es  su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito que tuvo.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevo soles, invertirá en materiales de costura, como telas e hilos en mayor cantidad. También comprará productos de belleza para tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
María, 54, is a very hardworking, enterprising, and happy woman who wants to get ahead.  She is separated from the father of her two daughters.  Now she lives only with them (Joelia, 20, and María, 9), whom she loves very much.  Her house is her own; she bought it with the help of her ex-partner.

Her work is sewing, a trade she learned by studying in an occupational education center.  She set herself up in this trade 15 years ago when she managed to buy her first sewing machine with her savings.  But she doesn't do it all the time because she also sells beauty products that she buys from a catalogue and sells to her friends.  She has been in this business for more than 30 years.

What she likes about her job is that she has an income to pay for the household expenses, be busy, and feel like a productive woman.  She would like to be able to expand her business and put in other machines, as well as install a display case for her beauty products.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know she will have financial help because that way she will feel confident about moving forward with her business.  On the other hand, she promises once again to make her payments on time, as she did with her previous loan.

With the requested amount of 1800 nuevos soles [PEN] she will invest in buying sewing supplies wholesale, such as fabric and thread.  She also will buy beauty products to have stock available for sale.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para el fortalecimiento de su negocio, comprandose los materiales para la elaboración de hamacas como hilo de seda de varios colores, manguillos, también comprará pan para salir a revender, esto le dará a que Tomasa lo esencial para que se mantenga ocupada y pueda generar ingresos para su familia.
Préstamo anterior le ayudó a realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de más hamacas, permitiéndole mantener una producción y poder ofrecer a los clientes, hoy día la cliente está separada de su esposo pero esta al lado de su hijo con quien comparte la vivienda.
texts.en:
Tomasa, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para el fortalecimiento de su negocio, comprandose los materiales para la elaboración de hamacas como hilo de seda de varios colores, manguillos, también comprará pan para salir a revender, esto le dará a que Tomasa lo esencial para que se mantenga ocupada y pueda generar ingresos para su familia.
Préstamo anterior le ayudó a realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de más hamacas, permitiéndole mantener una producción y poder ofrecer a los clientes, hoy día la cliente está separada de su esposo pero esta al lado de su hijo con quien comparte la vivienda.

loans.use: To buy silken thread in different colors, small handles and bread.

loans.name: Munkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhuu, 55, is an electrician and works in a private company with a low salary. He is widowed and lives with his daughter in the 'ger' district (a kind of slum district) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns an old house that was built many years ago. His house has been without any repair and renovation for many years. In winter he pays a lot to buy coal to warm his house because his house has heat loss through the windows, walls, floors, and other parts.

He wants to repair or replace the windows first among his repair plans. It costs a good deal, so he is requesting a loan to cover the cost of new windows and buy some building materials such as foam to make insulation for them. He really hopes that he will pay less for fuel after the repair and it is one of his contributions to the welfare of the environment.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new windows and buy the some building materials such as foam to make insulation for them.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident and a farmer in her rural home of Murang’a in Central Kenya. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 8 years old. Jane has 8 years in farming and currently sells her products of milk and maize to the local market.

Jane has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo and says she will use the loan to buy a chuff cutter and irrigation water pipes. She says this will ease the feeding of her dairy cows and save her more time.

Jane runs a butchery business for additional income in the local market and points out at frequent prices fluctuations as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and irrigation water pipes

loans.name: Frolence

texts.en:
Frolence is 50 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She raises livestock to earn a living, which she has been doing for three years.  She also sells soft drinks to generate extra income. 

Frolence is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy cows and goats. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a sus estudios, actualmente esta terminando sus estudios superiores como Técnico en Enfermería. 

Vilma es una persona luchadora, humilde, trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo esta terminando sus estudios; muchas veces se ve en la necesidad de viajar desde el lugar donde vive hasta donde realiza sus estudios que esta a dos horas y media en autobús. 

Gracias a su familia ella ha continuado sus estudios, manifiesta que ha sido una lucha fuerte para cumplir su sueño de graduarse de enfermera, trabajar ejerciendo su profesión apoyada por su familia y su comunidad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando Vilma, es para cancelar los gastos de graduación y concretizar su sueño más anhelado. Ella manifiesta que seguirá luchando para cumplir sus objetivos, como lo es el tener un trabajo para ayudar a su familia, mejorar su casa, si es posible ella desearía continuar estudiando para prepararse cada día más académicamente.
texts.en:
Vilma, 33, is single woman who is very dedicated to her education.  Currently she is finishing her advanced studies in nursing.

Vilma is a fighter and a modest, hardworking person who is finishing her studies with a lot of hard work.  Often she needs to travel from where she lives to where she goes to school, which is two-and-a-half hours by bus.

Thanks to her family she has continued with her studies.  She says it has been a big struggle to realize her dream of graduating as a nurse, to work in her profession supported by her family and her community.

The loan that Vilma is requesting is to pay off the expenses to graduate with her degree and to make her biggest dream come true.  She says she will continue to fight to achieve her goals, such as having a job to help her family and improve her house.  If possible, she would like to continue studying to be better prepared academically.

loans.use: to pay off her graduation expenses.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be a generous man. He has been involved in this business for eight years and employs one staff member. His business is located beside a busy highway  and his primary customers are residents from the area.

Timothy describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of raw material. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy scrap metals. His business goal is to run a supply company for scrap metals within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with profits generated.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is married. He has two children who both attend school. Harrison sells clothes, shoes, costume jewelry, etc.. He started selling at public institutions and private homes. With much effort and dedication, he managed to get ahead and thanks to his wife’s help they now have a locale at home where he conducts his sales.

He’s asking for the loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and costume jewelry to stock up and be able to continue offering a good variety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and costume jewelry

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 29-year-old single man from Kisumu City, West of Kenya and takes care of no one at the moment.

Peter sells a wide range of household items like spotlights, radios, belts and many other items. He has been in this business for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is now taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a stock of assorted household items. His profits will be used to add more stock. His dream is to have a big business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted household items for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in farming for three consecutive years in his rural home in Murang’a, which is located in central Kenya. He currently produces pepper, maize, beans, and bananas for the local market. He is married and has one child who is four years old.

John has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says upgrading his dairy farming will earn him more income, which he will use to educate his child. He hopes to increase his milk output so that he can supply other markets.

John notes, however, that the unpredictable climate conditions have been a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is twenty nine years old, married, with two children. He runs a manufacturing-machine repair business, and has been in this business for three years earning a monthly income of 20,000.

This will be his second loan from KADET Ltd. and he plans to buy a drilling machine. He plans to use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business. 

His hopes for the business and family are to buy more machines which will improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a drilling machine.

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.en:
Mahmudjon is a man of taste. From childhood he had a dream to build a wonderful castle. When he became older he tried to realize his dream. With the aim of finding more money he began his own business 20 years ago. His business is to grow vegetables such as tomatoes and carrots. He has additional income from animal husbandry. He has two children and a lovely wife. His wife helps him with the business. 

Mahmudjon works very hard but his income isn’t enough to build a new house. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials. He waits for your support. Please, help him to realize his childhood dream.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Capistrano

texts.en:
This is Capistrano, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is married to Ma. Rebecca, and is a father of three children. Together with his wife, he manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Capistrano operates an appliances-repair shop. They have one regular main technician and they have on-call workers when needed. He handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion of their business. They offer repair and check-up for all types of appliances like TVs, washing machines, air-con and others. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in service fees every day. 

 To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts for appliances. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.
  
Capistrano hopes to have another shop in the coming years and dreams of being able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work in his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for appliances needed in his business.

loans.name: Heraclia

texts.es:
Heraclia tiene 54 años, tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo vive y educa a dos de ellos. Su casa actual la obtuvo hace 7 años y se ubica en la localidad de Ataura.  
Los 15 años de experiencia que tiene en la agricultura, hacen que logre los objetivos que se propone. A pesar de haber terminado sólo la escuela primaria, comenzó a trabajar en un centro experimental de una de las universidades de su zona; ahí realiza toda variedad de productos lácteos como: queso, yogurt, manjar blanco y sus variantes. También apoya en la crianza de ovejas de raza, pues es conocedora del clima y los pastos que crece en esta zona. Por su trabajo recibe un buen sueldo, ello le permite tener una vida cómoda. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como gallinas, cuyes y ovejas, las cuales enseba y cuida con mucho esmero. “Yo misma siembro el pasto que tienen que comer, pues tienen que alimentarse de buena manera”, culmina. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos de cuyes para la capital del país, en este mes de fiestas patrias la demanda es mayor.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Le gusta trabajar en su grupo, pues las personas que lo conforman son responsables y siempre se apoyan entre ellas en cada reunión. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Heraclia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más cuyes, pues ya tiene muchos pedidos que satisfacer.
texts.en:
Heraclia is 54 years old and has five children, but only two of them still live with her since she must provide for their education. She obtained her house seven years ago and it is located in the town of Ataura.

Heraclia has 15 years of experience in agriculture and has been able to accomplish the goals that she has set for herself. Despite having only finished elementary school, she was able to start a job at an experimental center at one of the local universities where she produces all type of dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, “manjar blanco” (a caramel sauce made with milk), and other items. Heraclia also raises sheep since the area where she lives is known for its climate and pastures. Her job generates a good salary, which allows her to live comfortably. In addition, she buys and sells animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and sheep that she looks after with great care. “I also grow the fodder so that they will have something to eat and they are well fed,” concludes Heraclia. She now receives many orders for guinea pigs from the capital of Lima since there is greater demand due to the patron saint festivals that take place this month.

Heraclia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) and this is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her group because the other members are responsible and always supportive of her at each meeting. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her payments. Heraclia will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of more guinea pigs since she has many orders to fulfill.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a 'bibingka' (rice cakes) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fermented fish ('guinamos'). Herminia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her 'bibingka' business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her 'bibingka' making.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 28 years old, married to Elkanah and blessed with one child. She has run a clinic and a pharmacy for the past year, with a monthly income of 40,000 KES. This is her first loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD and she intends to use the entire amount to add assorted drugs for sale. This loan will boost her purchasing power. She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plan is to become a large scale health provider.

loans.use: to add assorted drugs for sale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana has worked as a petty trader of dresses, underwear, jeans, and shoes for the past three years.  She is married to a mason and they have five children. Susana uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more dresses to sell.  Susana wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods with the new profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase dresses to trade

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas lives with her husband and 5 children in Yabiw, near Takoradi, Ghana.  She operates a grocery store and has been in this business for two years. The items available in her grocery shop include milk, milo, sugar, different kinds of soft drinks, canned food products, biscuits, and other items.  Dorcas uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.  Dorcas plans to expand her business with the profits she will earn.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell from her shop

loans.name: Sreyhong's Group

texts.en:
Sreyhong is a young mother with two dependent sons. She is 24 years old and lives in a rural area of Dambae district, Kompong Cham province. Not much different from other villagers, she has been growing paddy rice on one hectare, and planting cassava on one and half hectares of farmland. It has been four years already that she has been involved in these businesses. 

Sreyhong has taken loans with VisionFund three times. She successfully managed to pay back all the loans, and they have improved her family's living conditions, in particular meaning that they got decent food. Now, she and her group member who just joind VisionFund this cycle are applying for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers for her field. She hopes to earn more income from her cash-crop so that she can have a big proper house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her field.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Cheam is a married woman who has been residing in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a mother of two children, who are married already. Cheam has been working in the agricultural businesses as the major source of the family’s income. She owns and manages a few hectares of farmland on which she can grow rice and vegetables for sale each harvesting season. For a better income, Cheam devotes her spare time to raising some piglets at home. After three to four months of fattening, she sells them to local tradesmen or butchers and earns a suitable income to support her family.

With her requested loan of USD 1,000, she would like to purchase a motorcycle to be used by her son in providing transportation services. Therefore, the household income will increase and they will be able to better the family living conditions. In the future, Cheam plans to buy 10 more piglets to fatten for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to be used by her son in providing transportation services.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 44 years old, married, with 12 children in all. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Her eldest is 26 years old and the youngest is five years old. She sells snack food at the school in San Miguel such as rice cakes, deep fried bananas coated with flour and sprinkled with sugar (locally known as maruya), cassava cake and ice candy (popsicle). Alejandra's husband works as a farmer and she is struggling to make both ends meet for her family especially her children. 

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like bananas, cassava, sugar, milk and sticky rice. Once the needed additional capital is within reach, she can just focus on improving her production. She will use her income for her children's school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cassava, sugar, milk and sticky rice.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province, Chan is a 53-year-old widow. She has five children, three of whom still need her support as they cannot earn much money as farmers. To strive for a living, she has been growing rice on a one-hectare field and planting cassava as the main source of income. She supplements this income for her family via porridge selling. It is the business that she has been with for 20 years and she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. For her, the dwindling price of cassava remains the key challenge. 

Now she is leading a group of two to request a loan from VisionFund as clients in their first cycle. She will use her portion of the loan to hire a laborer to remove weeds from her cassava field and to buy additional ingredients for her food selling business. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to remove weeds from her cassava field and to buy additional ingredients for her food selling business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos pequeños con los cuales vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudió hasta la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos porque se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en general ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia y con lo poco que gana trabajando por más de diez horas al día no le alcanza para comprar tela para sus trajes, es por eso que solicita el crédito, para comprar tela y confeccionar trajes para posteriormente venderlos.
El sueño de Rosario, es ampliar su taller y mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solícita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosario is a widow and has two young children who live with her in her own home where they occupy three rooms. Her house is located in the District of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

Rosario has a high school education and currently receives income by producing clothes. This is the only source of income by which she is able to cover the cost of food and basic services for her family. With the little that she earns after working more than 10 hours a day, Rosario is not able to buy fabric for making outfits. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric so that she can produce outfits to sell later.

Rosario’s dream is to expand her workshop and improve her income so that she can pay for her children’s education. This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Marek

texts.en:
Marek is 53 years old, married to Sophie, and has been blessed with three children that he supports. He has been a potato farmer in the Olchoro area in Narok for the last 12 years, getting a monthly income of KES 40,000. 


He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to buy farm inputs for better yields, and also to plow the land for planting.


He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and plow the land.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat, 59, is a married woman living in Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham Province. She has seven children, four of whom live with her; some are helping the family business while one of the remaining is a house-builder and another one is a teacher at a local public school. 

Yat has been farming on three hectares of farmland to overcome her family's hardships. From her current business, she is able to earn about 19,000 KHR per day. She took out her the first loan with VisionFund in 2011. The loan which she entirely paid back has enabled her to maintain her household better than before.

 Now she and her group member, as second cycle clients, are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Yat will use her loan to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her paddy rice growing business. She hopes to receive more crop yield and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to expand paddy rice growing business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mututua

texts.en:
Mututua is 40 years old, married, and supports three school-going children. He has been a maize farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs for better yields. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep-keeping. 


His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat has 2 small children and a lovely husband.  She must provide all of their necessities because her husband is carpenter and his salary is very small. Sharofat works hard from early morning until late evening in a clothing business that she has owned for 12 years. She sells clothing at the local market from her own stall and has a lot of customers. 

Sharofat has the experience to develop her business further, but her income doesn’t allow her to do so. While she has many friends, they cannot help to provide funds for her to develop her business. Sharofat is requesting a loan to buy goods for the new season.

loans.use: To buy clothing goods to sell for the new season

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.en:
Fahriddin is a smart and clever man with a higher degree. He is a teacher in the local school and also a very successful businessman. He has also been busy with animal husbandry. Fahriddin has three children, two sons and a daughter. He loves them very much and tries to do the best for them. His lovely wife helps him with his business. 

They want to repair the house they live in, but do not have enough money for it. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials to repair his house. He waits for your help and support.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-six-year-old single mother of two school-going children. She runs a charcoal business and has been in this business for ten years, earning a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. and she plans to use it to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to plough back into her business. 

She hopes to start a shop making beads to sell to tourists in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products at wholesale prices. Items such as food, beverages and household items will be used to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to start up a cosmetics business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of cosmetics. She is grateful for the loans she is receiving from Kiva and Yehu, which enabled her to grow and expand her business, and earn enough income to sustain her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and renovate her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en: Tai is requesting a new loan to expand his business by buying more gas tanks from different suppliers to satisfy his customers. Tai's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers, and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gas tanks to sell

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena lives together with her husband and eight children near Takoradi, Ghana.  She sells cooking oil, which she has done for six years. Mena uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

Mena will use her loan to purchase gallons of palm oil and boxes of vegetable oil to sell. She plans to expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm oil and boxes of vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with two children and has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She is hardworking and dedicated. Thanks to all of her efforts, her children are in school.  Hidaya says that she never had the opportunity to study. Therefore, her greatest wish is to see all of her children become professionals so that they can have a better future.

Hidaya has a well-stocked food pantry that supplies goods to the people in her neighborhood. She is requesting the loan to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, meats, and other basic items to restock her business.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of foods, such as milk, confectionery, and household items to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of foods such as different sorts of milk, confectionery, and household items

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 40 years old, married to Jackline and has been blessed with three children that he supports. He has been a potato farmer for the last four years, getting a monthly income of KES12,000. 


He has applied for his second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to acquire farm inputs for better yields.


He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Loi would like to take a further loan to buy more beverages to sell from her stall. Loi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to serve her customers.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 35 years old and is married. She has four children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working in a local company. Thao has been running a cafe and a general store in front of her door for seven years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her two children. 

Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kind of soft drinks to sell from her store. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and earn enough money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks

loans.name: Franklin Fernando

texts.es: Franklin vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo la cual pertenece a las costas ecuatorianas del país. Hace 10 empezó su negocio de el cual es la venta de bolos, en sus inicios solo vendía en su domicilio por lo que compraba pocas fundas ya que la demanda era muy baja. Con el pasar del tiempo decidió comprar una hielera portátil con lo cual empezó a recorrer diversos sectores del la ciudad, al principio se le hizo un poco difícil ya que se dedico en su mayor parte a la promoción ahora tiene clientes fijos a los que visita y vende el producto por paquetes. Franklin realiza solo lo recorridos ya que las ganancias le permiten cubrir solo sus gastos pero no podría pagar un ayudante. Con el crédito va a comprar bolos por paquetes para su venta ya sea en unidades o en fundas. Le gustaría a futuro poder crecer más en el negocio para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Franklin lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is located on Ecuadorian coast. Ten years ago, he started a business of selling ice pops. He began selling from home by purchasing a few cases since demand was very low. As time passed, he decided to buy a portable cooler and began traveling to different areas of the city. At first he found it to be difficult because most of his time was spent on promotions, but now he has established customers who visit him and buy his product by the packet.

Franklin works alone and his earnings are only enough to cover his expenses, so he is not able to hire an assistant. His loan will be used to buy ice pops in packets that he will sell individually or by the case. In the future, he would like to grow his business even more so that he can provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy ice pops to sell.
