This in turn will allow his to keep on working and fighting every day to make his biggest dream come true: “To have a house of his own and to provide a good education to his child”.

loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is married and lives in Likoni. She has made her living selling clothing for more than 4 years. She has a well-established clientele, which is a great help. She has been a client of Yehu since the beginning of the year, and thanks to the help she has received from them, she has been able to keep her business growing.
Sakina has a boutique in which she sells new clothing and Khangas (wrap cloth used by African women). In addition, she operates an open-air food business.
She is requesting the loan to purchase jeans, t-shirts, and blouses and to purchase 40 pieces for Khangas, which will all help her to stock her business and to continue filling her customers' requests.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, t-shirts, and blouses and to purchase 40 pieces for Khangas (wrap cloth used by African women).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married mother of twins aged 7 years old who go to school. A long-time specialist in the sale of cereals in a small store, Lilian buys her stock at a market in the neighboring town at a cheaper price.
Given her experience, she is requesting assistance from Yehu to better meet the needs of her clientele and to maximize interest in her merchandise.

The profits earned will allow her to provide her children with adequate health care and education and will support her own needs.
Lilian intends to use the requested loan to purchase stocks of maize, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a divorced mother of two children who both attend school. Previously, she worked in the home of a family and gradually she got together the money to open a small business, to be nearer her children. This way she became independent and, thanks to her sales strategy, her business grew.

She is a very hardworking person and she shows it every day working in her small store. Thanks to her hard work, she gives her son everything he needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beverages, sugar, and flour. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her; this is very important support for her because the loan is her only opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar creates realistic sculptures and figurines from gemstones. He would like to stock up on raw materials and also upgrade his stone-cutting tools.

Cesar has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Cesar has worked as a stone carver since 1988. Cesar works with serpentine, rose manganese, calcite, celestite, red jasper, mottramite, chrysocolla, rhodochrosite and quartz. "I work in stone because of the beautiful things that can be made with each kind," he says. "I like stone's naturalness and purity of color." Of his four children, it is his eldest daughter who has shown the most interest in her father's art and in carrying on his craft.

"Selling my works through NOVICA has elevated my sense of inspiration, motivating me to continue growing as an artist and to develop new designs. My problem is that sometimes it's hard to find good quality stones — every day it seems they are scarcer and more expensive. When I heard about this interest-free microcredit opportunity, I felt a huge relief. Now I won't miss an opportunity to buy good materials. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Cesar's work on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3600

loans.use: to purchase gemstones in bulk and upgrade his stone-cutting tools.

loans.name: Ummikulthum

texts.en:
Ummikulthum is from Likoni, Mombasa. She is single and has no children. She is very hardworking and responsible, and a very honest lady. According to what she told us, she started out working as a waitress in a restaurant. Her dream has always been to have an eatery and to sell beverages in general at home. Today she has her own business; she has regular clientele and a good income thanks to her work and effort.

Ummikulthum tells us that she wants to continue growing and this is why she always strives and works sunup to sundown and why she’s asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients for her eatery. She is thankful for the support she’s getting from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silver to expand production.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Nyoman recalls, "My first exposure to the arts was in elementary school, when I began learning to carve wood. My grandfather, an architect of traditional Balinese buildings and also a senior carver, was very supportive of me. Later, my father introduced me to a leading silversmith in my village, and I began to learn from him." Today, Nyoman makes good use of his wood carving ability, combining it with his silver work to produce a variety of intricate designs.

"A million thanks for your attention and support! This interest-free microcredit will allow me to increase my production capacity, which I hope will translate into increased sales. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nyoman's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3703

loans.use: to purchase silver in bulk and expand production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old, married, and lives in Samburu, Kenya. She manages a taxi business where she has hired someone. To look for more alternatives, she decided to open an internet cafe. She provides variety of services such as browsing, printing, etc. She has several years experience.

Elizabeth has already received previous loans from Yehu and has shown herself to be responsible, honest, and of good character. The loans have been very helpful to her in growing her business as she has been able to invest in working capital. She has requested this loan to buy printer paper and toner. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future and to ensure that her three children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy printer paper and toner.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 30 años, tiene tres hijos. Con ellos, vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Yanamarca.  
Hace 4 años emprendió su negocio de compra y venta de verduras, granos y tubérculos. Su madre, quien es su socia, vive en la capital y a quién Lourdes le envía los productos para que los venda allá. “Cada vez que obtengo, una carga de alimentos, le mando a mi madre a la capital para que comercialice”, afirma. En temporadas de cosecha es cuando tiene que aprovechar al máximo, ya que los alimentos cuestan muy poco y pueden obtener más ganancias. Su trabajo es muy bueno, pues es mayorista y reparten a los comerciantes minoristas que llegan a los mercados más grandes del país. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “La rosa de Guadalupe” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo financiero durante todo estos años, pues pudo administrar su dinero y volverlo productivo. Además, le gusta mucho el trabajo con su banco comunal, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  
Lourdes invertirá este dinero en la compra de menestras y verduras, por toneladas, para seguir con su negocio y abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old and has three children.  She lives with them in her parents home which is located in the town of Yanamarca.  

Four years ago she began her business of buying and selling vegetables, grains and tubers.  Her mother, who is her partner, lives in the capital and Lourdes sends her the products so that she can sell them there: "Each time that I obtain an order of foods, I send it to my mother in the capital so that she can sell it," she affirms.  During the harvest season is when she has to take advantage of the opportunities to their maximum, since the foods cost very little and she can obtain a better income.  Her work is very very good, since she purchases in bulk and it is then sold to smaller businesses that arrive at the largest markets in the country.  

She belongs to the communal banking group "La rosa de Guadalupe" and this is her sixth credit with MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support received during all these years, since she was able to administer her money carefully and make it productive.  Besides, she likes the work of the communal bank very much, and thus she promises to be punctual with the repayments of the loan.  

Lourdes will invest this money in the purchase of mixed vegetables and greens, by the ton, in order to continue with her business and to supply her clients.

loans.use: To purchase assorted vegetables and greens by the ton for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 7 children ranging from 13 years old to 28 years old. She describes herself to be a diligent woman. She operates a farm where she sells milk and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power from customers. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy dairy cow feed. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy cow feed.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a master carver from Bali, specializing in wood sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of wood to expand production.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"Most of my family members are carvers, for it is a family legacy that has endured several generations. You could say I was born with a talent to carve, which I developed by merely observing my parents and relatives at work every day. My inspiration comes from Balinese customs and traditions. Competition is tough here in Bali, for there are many expert carvers, making the life of a carver a very uncertain one. It means that I must excel, so hopefully my sculptures will be well received.

"Thanks to all of you who support me with this interest-free microcredit. I really hope these funds can help develop my small carving business by preparing a better stock of sculptures and allowing me to improve sales. My deepest gratitude to you."

Use the link below to view Wayan's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4352

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of wood and expand his wood carving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN TRABAJA EN UNA MAQUILADORA,SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA  ALAS LAVORES DE EL HOGAR Y AL CUIDADO DE SU HIJA QUE SE ENCUENTRA CURSANDO EL PRE ESCOLAR
JUAN TIENE EL DECEO DE PINTAR LA FACHADA DE SU CASA EN EXTERIOIR Y INTERIOR DE SU HOGAR,YA QUE CON ELPASO DEL EL TIEMPO SE A HIDO GASTANDOI YA SE MIRA EN MALAS CONDICIONES.
ASI MISMO ANDOLES UN PATRIMONIO DIGNO A SU ESPOSA E HIJA
texts.en: Juan works in a factory and his wife works in the home taking care of their daughter who is preschool age.  Juan desires to paint the outside of his house, both the exterior and interior walls since with the passage of time the wood is beginning to need protection.  It already looks in bad condition.  In this way he would like to provide a decent home for his wife and daughter.

loans.use: To paint the exterior and interior walls of his house.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelo  tiene 61 años y tiene hijos ya independientes, el es  Agricultor se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos en su parcela que se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de Rio Seco, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr   Marcelo va a usar este préstamo  para la siembra de maíz y compra de cerdo,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Para obtener recursos para subsistir, el Sr.  Marcelo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para mantenerse  y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su producción la Sr. Marcelo vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Mr. Marcelo is 61 years old and has two adult children.  He is a farmer and works growing corn and raising pigs on his parcel that is found in the city of Rio Seco.  This loan is his first sequence with Kiva.  Marcelo is going to use this loan to plant corn and to purchase pigs.  His reason for requesting the loan is to gain the necessary income in order to subsist.  Marcelo faces challenges in his work which include trying to improve his quality of life since farming is his only economic activity and he needs the income to maintain himself.  He is going to use the money to improve his production.  Marcelo sells his products in the local market directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to plant corn.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol, Junto a su esposo e hijos habitantes del municipio de Ticuantepe, sus planes a futuro es tener una mejora de vida y terminar su casa, el le apoya con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de sus hijos. Doña Marisol en el credito anterior reparo la parte delantera de su casa ya que estaba demasiado deteriorado pero con estas lluvias ya el techo de la parte trasera esta filtrando agua y lo cambiara.
con este credito comprara: Laminas de Zinc, Perlines y Cielo Razo. para asi no tener mas problemas con las lluvias, Agradece a Afodenic el apoyo que le brinda atravez de fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Marisol lives with her husband and children in the city of Ticuantepe.  Their goals for the future are to have a better life and finish constructing their house.  Her husband supports her with the household expenses and their children's school costs.  With her previous loan she repaired the front part of her home since it had deteriorated.  However, due to the rain, her roof is now leaking water and she plans to replace it.

With the loan funds she will buy corrugated sheet metal, wooden beams, and materials for the ceiling so that she will not have further problems with the rain leaking in.  She thanks Afodenic for the support the are giving her by means of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheet metal, wooden beams and hardware.

loans.name: Raul Franchezco

texts.es:
Raúl es un joven de 19 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de apoyar a su familia; gracias al apoyo de sus padres Raúl pudo estudiar una carrera técnica de computación y actualmente gracias a su trabaja se encuentra estudiando la carrera de gastronomía que tanto quiere; en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar diversos postres y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Raúl trabaja como técnico en una empresa de refacción y mantenimiento de computo de la su ciudad, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Raúl se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de estudio, tales como: cuadernos, libros, mandiles y diversos utensilios de cocina; de esta manera Raúl contará con los útiles necesarios para poder seguir estudiando su carrera de gastronomía, así él espera poder culminar satisfactoriamente su profesión para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su propio restaurant y con ello desea seguir apoyando a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 19 year old young man.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha.  In spite of his young age he is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  He has a great desire to succeed, and he really wants to support his family.  Thanks to the support of his parents, Raúl was able to study computer technology.

Thanks to his work, he is currently studying for a degree in the culinary arts, which he loves so much.  In his free time he likes to make delicious Arroz Chaufa [fried rice] to share with his family. 

With great determination and enthusiasm, Raúl works day to day as a technician at a computer repair and maintenance company in his city.  He works approximately ten hours a day.  He is happy doing this work because they treat him with respect because of his good performance and how kindly he treats others.

Raúl is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they gave him, he will be able to buy materials for his education.  He will buy materials like notebooks, books, aprons, and different kitchen utensils.  This way Raúl will have the materials needed to be able to continue studying the culinary arts.  

This way he hopes to be able to satisfactorily complete his professional studies.  He hopes to do this so that in the near future he will be able to have his own restaurant.  With his own restaurant he wishes to continue helping his family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials like notebooks, books, aprons, and different kitchen utensils for his studies.

loans.name: Vitaliano

texts.es:
Vitaliano tiene 33 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja quien trabaja como obrera agrícola, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo, también se cultiva pallares, frejoles, maíz, entre otros. Junto a su esposa Vitaliano tiene 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad y por quienes trabaja muy duro para darles una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor y honradez. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho mirar película  y disfrutar con su familia uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Picante e cochallullo. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de medicina veterinaria.

Día a día Vitaliano trabaja en su cultivo de algodón, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día, ya que tiene mucho cuidado en el regado de su cultivo y sobre todo verifica si tiene alguna plaga o si los brotes crecen de mera correcta; el  cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy cuidadoso y sobre todo responsable.

Vitaliano está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, con eta mejora el podrá obtener una buena cosecha y su cultivo crecerá sin problemas, así de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Vitaliano, 33, lives with his partner, an agricultural worker.  His home is in the city of Camaná, known for its agriculture, especially its rice, considered some of the best in the world.  They also grow butter beans, beans, and corn, among other products.  Vitaliano and his wife have two small children, ages 4 and 7, for whom they work very hard and with a lot of love and honesty so they will have a decent life.

When he has some free time he likes to watch movies and enjoy with his family one of his favorite dishes, the delicious spicy "cochayuyo."  Because of his parents' limited resources he only finished secondary school, but he would have liked to study veterinary medicine.

Every day Vialiano works on his cotton crop.  He spends about 10 hours a day on his job because he is very careful to irrigate his crop and especially verify whether he has any pests or if the plants are growing correctly.  He believes it is going well for him in his job because he is very careful and responsible.

Vitaliano is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy manure and fertilizer for his crops.  With this improvement he will be able to get a good harvest and his crop will grow without any problems.  This way he will be able to improve his income and fight to make his biggest dream come true: "To give his children a profession."

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA ANABEL, ES DUEÑA DE UN NEGOCIO APOYADA POR SU ESPOSO
SUS DOS HIJOS,QUE AL SALIR DE SU ESUELA COLABORAN AYUDANDOLE A SU MAMA
EN LE NEGOCIO.
ANABEL TIENE EL PROPISITO,DE COMPRAR METERIA  PRIMA  
CON LA CUAL LE ES INDISPENSABLE  TRABAJAR 
Y ASI A LA VEZ AHUMENTAR LA PRODUCTIVIDAD DE SU NEGOCIO
ASI TENER MAS INGRESOSPARA PODER AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO
LO CUAL LE BENEFICIA EN EL AMBITO LABORAL Y FAMILIAR.
texts.en: Anabel is the owner of a business, in which her husband helps her.  When her two children come home from school, they also help her in the business.   She needs to buy ingredients and supplies that are key to her business so that she can increase her productivity.  In this way she will have more income to be able to grow her business, which will benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La socia Elena sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella sigue con el negocio de venta de ropa y sigue con el pequeño puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa de niños, damas, caballeros y otras más.
texts.en:
Elena continues to participate in the “Luz del Sur” [Light of the South] communal bank.  It is going very well for her thanks to the punctual payments.  

She continues with her business of selling clothes, and she continues with her small sales stand.  She has devoted herself to this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.

This time Elena needs the loan to buy clothes for children, women, and men, and other things.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children, women, and men, and other things.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristóbal de 53 años de edad, un hombre casado que vive con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 24 y 31 años. Él tiene una fábrica de bollo blanco, amasijo elaborado a base de maíz, que se somete a la molienda, amasado, empaque y cocción final. Su producto es típico del departamento del Atlántico y es muy consumido por las familias a la hora del desayuno o la cena y en los restaurantes o negocios de comidas rápidas, que lo acompañan con asados y frituras. Sus ventas las realiza con una frecuencia diaria, a clientes propietarios de tiendas y establecimientos de ventas de alimentos  y también vende directamente a los vecinos del sector. También aprovecha el agua donde cocina el maíz, para fabricar la famosa chicha, una bebida refrescante que sirve con hielo picado. Su negocio está cumpliendo su cometido, pues el nació por la necesidad de generar ingresos, para el sostenimiento de su familia y esto es justamente lo que ha logrado. Su principal meta es consolidar su actividad ya que es bastante rentable, por eso poco a poco aplicará capital de crédito, como es el que está solicitando a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen maíz, utensilios de mayor capacidad y también para reparará su molino. Su mayor desafío es remplazar las deudas de alto costo, por el nuevo crédito y esto es justamente lo que potencializa el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: 53-year-old Cristóbal is a married man who lives with his wife. He has two children aged 24 and 31. He owns a factory that produces "bollo blanco" (white bun), a corn-based mix that's milled, kneaded, packed and, lastly, cooked. His product is a typical one from the department of the Atlantic, and it's widely consumed by the families for breakfast or dinner. It's also consumed in restaurants or fast food outlets, which serve it with barbecued and fried meats. He makes his sales on a daily basis. His customers are owners of stores and food selling businesses, and he also sells directly to his neighbors from the area. He also uses the water from cooking the corn to make the famous "chicha", a refreshing beverage he serves with crushed ice. His business is fulfilling its purpose, since it got started out of the need to get an income to support his family, and that's just what he achieved. His main goal is to strengthen his business, because it's very profitable. That's why he will progressively invest his loan capital, such as the one he's requesting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, his first Kiva loan. With it he'll purchase corn in bulk and utensils of greater capacity, and he'll also repair his mill. His biggest challenge is to replace high-cost debts with the new loan, and that's exactly what boosts the success of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and utensils of greater capacity, and also to repair his mill.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 41-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, onions, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Her business is located within a busy shopping centre and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of fruits, especially in dry seasons. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fruits to the nearby hometown within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have built her own permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
2012-179

	Banco Mujer Emprendedoras presenta la solicitud de crédito de 9 integrantes,  quienes han trabajado desde hace 8 años como grupo organizado en Fray Casiano, zona  de alta pobreza en Puntarenas. Han  demostrando buen manejo de los conceptos de trabajo grupal (solidaridad, ahorro y además de coordinar actividades generando fondos),  tiene reglas claras de trabajo. Ellas han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.1 de formación del Banco Mujer Emprendedoras.

 
	 Su trabajo y  esfuerzo les ha permitido tener la actividad de comercio ambulante  mejor consolidada, situación que se corrobora en la visita realizada a cada una de las solicitantes. 

Erika, integrante del grupo invertirán su crédito  en la compra de sandalias, ropa, artículos de belleza y mercadería en general, incrementando su inventario  y cubriendo pedidos para la época de vacaciones y día de la madre. Además, realizan ventas de comida y rifas que les permiten incrementar su ahorro y apoyar a sus familia en los gastos del hogar y estudio de los hijos, ya que la de las integrantes son madres solteras y jefas de hogar y su aporte económico es muy importante para la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus hijos e hijas. 

	Ericka es una  mujer muy luchadora y gracias a la organización interna del grupo logra realizar  la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal,  lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio para la obtención del dinero para el pago. Su presidenta se dedica a la venta de  ropa y consideran ha sido una buena líder  y   esperan contar con esté préstamo para seguir creciendo cada día.

	Son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de la organización han logrado superarse y mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, apoyando en el estudio a sus hijos y a sus parejas a contribuir en la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
2012-179

The Mujer Emprendedoras ["Entrepreneurial Women"] Bank presents the loan request of nine members who have worked together as an organized group in Fray Casiano for 8 years. This is an area of Puntarenas with a high level of poverty. These women have demonstrated a good grasp of the concepts of group work (solidarity, savings, and coordinating activities to generate income) and have clear work rules. They have requested loans and know the discipline of group work.
They have formed a board of directors, and the original documents were prepared to set up the 'Entrepreneurial Women' communal bank.
Their hard work and effort has allowed each of them to be better street merchants; this fact was evidenced in the meetings with each member.
Erika, a group member, will invest this loan in the purchase of sandals, clothing, beauty products, and general merchandise, increasing her inventory and covering orders for the vacation season and Mothers' Day. These women also sell food and raffle tickets, which allows them to increase their savings and support their families by covering household costs and their children's studies. The majority are single mothers, the heads of their households, and their economic contributions are very important for their quality of life and that of their sons and daughters.
Erika is a very hard-working woman, and thanks to the group's internal organization she will be able to pay back the loan weekly, which will allow her to have a wider margin to get the money for repayment. Their group president sells clothing. They feel that she has been a good leader. They hope to get this loan so that they can keep growing every day.
They are hard-working women. Through their organization they have been able to succeed and improve their families' incomes, supporting their children's studies and helping their partners to contribute to the household funds.

loans.use: various businesses: clothing sales, shoes, perfume, and others. It will be invested in anticipation of the vacation period and mothers' day.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 65-year-old widowed woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be a God-fearing woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells molasses. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located within a dry area and her primary customers are dairy farmers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of molasses during the rainy season due to impassible roads to her business premises. 

Damaris will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more molasses for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor of molasses within five years. 

She hopes that in the future she will buy a motorbike with the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy ten drums of molasses for resale.

loans.name: Selmira Consuelo

texts.es:
Selmira es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 44 años y vive al lado de su pareja y juntos tiene una hija al que ama muchísimo y por quien trabaja muy duro para darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y también por la generosidad y amabilidad de sus pobladores.  Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Selmira le gusta mucho ver televisión y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de su padres Selmira solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser profesora de arte.

Con mucho Selmira trabaja en su pequeño negocio de peluquería desde hace ya 5 años, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día; ella cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene mucha creatividad.

Selmira está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comparar utensilios como secadoras, mandiles, gorros  de mechas, tintes, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener los materiales necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo y también mejorar su ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija”.
texts.en:
Selmira is a hard-working woman.  She is 44 years old and lives alongside her partner.  The couple have a daughter who they love very much and for whom they work very hard in order to give her a decent life and, above all, a lot of love.  Their home is located in Parcona district which is known for its warm climate and also for the generosity and kindness of the local people.  Whenever she has any free time, Selmira really enjoys watching television and eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'arroz con pato' (rice with duck).  Owing to her parents' lack of money, Selmira was only able to study to high school  level. However, she would have loved to have studied to become an art teacher.

Selmira has been working hard in her small hairdressing business for five years.  She works around eight hours a day and can serve up to ten customers a day.  She believes that her business is going well because she is friendly with her customers and, above all, she has a lot of creativity.

Selmira is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy supplies such as dryers, aprons, highlight caps, dyes, etc.  This will enable her to have available all the materials she needs to carry out her work and improve her income.  This will allow her to continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: to provide her daughter with a profession.

loans.use: to buy dryers, aprons, highlight caps, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 45-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a polite and God-fearing man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells items such as salt, cooking fat, sugar, etc. Also included are vegetables such as tomatoes, etc. 

He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located within the slopes of Mt. Kenya and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

Patrick will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy items such as flour, cooking fat, and sugar. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of household items within five years. 

He hopes that in the future he will be able to meet all his customers’ needs and satisfy them.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Darwich

texts.en:
Darwich is a 48-year-old married man, the father of three children. He is a hard worker with a very good reputation.  He works hard to provide his family with the best living. 

Darwich has worked in auto repair for five years. He specializes in changing cars' oil and batteries. He is well known in the region for the good quality of the work he does. 

Darwich applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his stock of automobile oil and lubricants, in addition to car batteries.

This will improve his business in a remarkable way.  This is Darwich's twelveth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with an excellent repayment history.

Darwich is always optimistic and knows how to invest his money in business well.  He hopes to keep on expanding and improving his business in a very impressive way to keep his family satisfied.

loans.use: To increase his stock of oil and lubricants, in addition to car batteries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO SE DEDICA A LAS LAVORES DE ALBAÑILERIA
YA QUE PERDIO LA GRAN MAYORIA DE LAS HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO
NECECITA COMPRAR NUEVAS PARA PODER ASI CONTRIBUIR EN SU TRBAJO 
SU ESPOSA TIENE UN PUESTO DE TACOS LA CUAL  LE APOYA ECONOMICAMENTE, ADEMAS DE ESO EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES EL SR Y SU ESPOSA VENDEN ROPA. US HIJOS SON PEQUEÑOS PERO GARCIAS A QUE SUS EMPLEOS LES PERMITEN CUIDARLOS. SUS METAS ES SEGUIR TENIEDO TRABAJO PARA DARLES UN FUTURO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Francisco is a construction worker. As he lost the great majority of his work tools, he needs to buy new ones in order to be able to engage in his occupation. 

His wife has a taco stand, which supports them financially.  Besides that, in their free time he and his wife sell clothing. They children are small, and thanks to their jobs they can look after them. 

Their goal is to continue having work, so that they can provide their children with a future.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Wilfran

texts.es: A sus 23 años de edad Wilfran es propietario de 2 negocios,  por un lado tiene un puesto de ventas de comidas rápidas y por otro vende ropa, calzado, accesorios femeninos etc. Con ambas actividades, genera ingresos para sostenerse en su carrera de salud ocupacional, que cursa y en general para responder a sus gastos personales. El inició trabajando como empleado en la publicidad de una   discoteca, de allí reunió dinero,  compró mercancía y empezó a venderla entre sus amistades, vecinos y amigos;  su negocio comercial creció gradualmente y por eso decidió salirse de su anterior empleo y poner un punto de ventas de comidas rápidas, en el cual aun  trabaja los feriados y los fines de semana,  desde el viernes, hasta el domingo, mientras que en su otro negocio trabaja los otros días que le quedan. Su meta mas adelante es lograr ser un profesional de la salud y también genera ingresos teniendo sus 2 negocios   en un local bien posicionado y atendido por sus empleados. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará con una parte del dinero,  panes, embutidos, carnes y sillas para mejorar el servicio de su punto comercial de alimentos y con la otra parte comprará prendas de vestir casual, celulares, prendas de plata, que tiene encargado por sus clientes a quienes quiere obedecer para hacerlos cada vez mas fieles a su negocio.
texts.en: At 23 years of age, Wilfran runs two businesses - on one hand he owns a fast food stall, and on the other hand he sells clothing, shoes, women's accessories, etc. Both businesses earn him profits for supporting himself in his career in the field of occupational health, which he studies. They also allow him to pay for his personal expenses in general. He got his start by working as an employee doing publicity for a nightclub. From that job he saved money, bought merchandise and began selling it among his acquaintances, neighbors and friends. His business gradually grew, and therefore he decided to leave his previous job and set up a fast food stall. He still works there on holidays and weekends from Friday through Sunday, and on the remaining days he works on his other business. His goal for later is to successfully become a health care professional. He also aims to earn profits by running his two businesses in a store that's well located and well served by his employees. He's currently requesting a Kiva loan, which he'll use in part to purchase bread, cold cuts, meats and chairs in order to improve the service in his food stall, and in part to purchase casual garments, cell phones and silver jewelry. These products were ordered by his customers, whom he wants to please, so that they become increasingly faithful to his business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cold cuts, meats and chairs in order to improve the service in his food stall, and also to purchase casual garments, cell phones and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El socio el Sr. Nazario; el socio sigue dedicandose a prestar el servicio de taxi,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,a la vez el socio continua con su negocio de compra y venta de madera,el socio vende madera a sus clientes que le solicitan.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nazario, continues to work as a taxi driver.  He has been in this business for a long time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. 

At the same time, the borrower continues his business buying and selling wood. He sells wood to his customers who request it. 

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 25-year-old single man who has worked in agriculture since 2008.

Jaafar is a hard worker.  He plants olives and grapes, in addition to trading with fresh milk and beef.

Jaafar is a man with a good reputation. His enthusiasm and courage to develop himself and his work are well known in his village.

Jaafar applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, for the first time in order to open a convenience store and to buy more sheep. This loan will help a lot in increasing his income and expanding his business.

He hopes to keep on improving his business and to start planning to make a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to open a convenience store and buy more sheep.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea sigue dedicandose a la compra y venta de leche ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a la agricultura y a la venta de madera,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de leche para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Andrea still buys and sells milk. The member works by making traveling sales to customers who request her product. Also, she still dedicates herself to agriculture and wood sales. The member is a responsible and hardworking person, and that's how she gets her family ahead.
The member requests the loan in order to purchase milk for her business.
She's thankful for the loan she received, and she pledges to comply with her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to purchase milk for her business.

loans.name: Eduart

texts.en:
Eduart is 34 years old and married, with two children; five and three years old. The family lives in the central eastern part of Albania.  Eduart is known by others for being a hard-worker and a responsible man.

For the past eight years, Eduart has owned his dairy farm.  He sells milk and dairy products to the local market.  To bring them there, which he usually does every day, he often takes the bus. 

Now, he is planning to purchase a motorcycle, though, to make it easier. For this, Eduart is requesting a KIVA loan via VisionFund Albania.  It will be his second loan, with the previous one being paid off.

Eduart believes he will be able to sell more if he used a motorcycle to transport his products. This will increase the profit, which he plans to use to build a dairy farm and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to bring his dairy products to market.

loans.name: Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Las Mujeres Progresistas son un grupo solidario del municipio de García, Nuevo León. Ellas son un grupo de nueve mujeres emprendedoras que está cumpliendo su tercer ciclo en esta institución sin ninguna complicación. 
Maricela Flores es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella está casada y tiene 38 años. Junto con su esposo tiene 3 hijos, el mayor, Luis, tiene 19 años y está trabajando, los menores, Rosa de 14 y Juan de 7 continúan estudiando. Maricela se dio cuenta hace un par de años de la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Por lo que hace 2 años comenzó con su negocio de venta de suplementos alimenticios con sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. Maricela solicitó este crédito para comprar más productos ya que varios de sus clientes ya le hicieron pedidos y sólo están esperando que se los entregue. Maricela sueña con seguir haciendo crecer su negocio y ganar más clientes para poder proveerles a sus hijos del mejor futuro posible.
texts.en:
"Las Mujeres Progresistas" (The Progressive Women) is a supportive group in the municipality of García, Nuevo León.  They are a group of nine enterprising women who are completing their third cycle with the institution problem-free.
Maricela Flores is one of the women in the group.  She is married and is 38 years old.  Together with her husband, she has 3 children.  The oldest, Luis, is 19 years old and employed.  The younger ones, 14 year old Rosa and 7 year old Juan are in school.  A few years ago, Maricela realized that she needed to generate an income to help her husband with the household expenses.  And so 2 years ago she started a business selling supplements to her neighbors, family and friends.  Maricela requested the loan to purchase more products, as some of her customers have already placed orders and are waiting for them to be delivered.  Maricela hopes to keep growing her business and to earn more customers to be able to give her children the best possible future

loans.use: to purchase more products.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SOLEDAD, Y SU ESPOSO EL SÑR:HORACIO 
TIENEN AÑOS DE RADICAR  AQUÍ,SOLEDA ES ENFERMERA EN EL CENTRO DE SALUD
SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO ROTULISTA,PARA EL AYUNTAMIENTO
AUN ASI  EL SEÑOR HORACIO Y LA SEÑORA SOLEDAD BUSCAN TRABAJO POR FUERA
PARA TENER UN INGRESO EXTRA 
EL PROPOSITO DE LA SEÑORA SOLEDAD ES:AMPLIAR  LA CASA ,MODIFICARLA DE INTERIOR AL EXTERIOR
ASI MISMO POR LA INSEGURIDAD QUE SE VIVEHOY EN DIA LA SEÑORA SOLEDAD 
DESEA BARDIAR  SU HOGAR 
ASI MEJOANDO SU CALIDAN DE VIDA DE LA SEÑORA SOLEDAD
texts.en:
Soledad and her husband Horacio have been living here for years. Soledad is a nurse at the health center, and her husband works for the municipality as a sign-writer. Even so, Soledad and Horacio are seeking outside work in order to have extra income. 

Soledad's aim is to expand the house and upgrade it inside and out. As well, because of the lack of safety being experienced today, Soledad wishes to build a wall around her home. This way she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To expand the upper floor of her home.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
LA SRA ESTRELLA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO AN  LOGRADO CON ESFUERZO DESARROLLAR UN PATRIMONIO PARA SUS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO ALBAÑIL PARA UNA COSTRUCTORA Y EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES  REALIZA TRABAJOS PARA TENER UN INGRESO EXTRA.
I ASI CONTRIBUIR A LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR
ESTRELLA TIENE YA MUCHO TIEMPO DEDICANDOCE A LA COMPR Y VENTA DE ROPA USADA
DECEA COMPRAR MAS I DE TODO TIPO DE MERCANCIA 
YA QUE AUN QUE SU GANANCIA EXISTE SIEMPRE TIENE QUE ESTAR RENOVANDO SU MERCANCIA
texts.en:
La Sra Estrella, together with her husband and some effort, has been able to put together some assets for their children.  Her husband works as a brick-layer for a construction company.  In his free time, he does side work for extra income.  
That is how he contributes to the household expenses.
For a long time, Estrella has been making a living buying and selling second-hand clothing.
She wants to purchase more of all kinds of merchandise. 
Even though she is earning a profit, she always needs to be updating her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Duo Amanecer De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
dúo amanecer de san Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña hortensia, ella tiene 54 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de producto por catalogo , como cosméticos , desinfectantes, ropa y zapatos. En san Bartolomé como vendedora ambulante, doña tencha como la  llaman sus clientes dice que como ya es bastante conocida en el área, cuando sus clientes necesitan producto la visitan en su casa, por lo que siempre acostumbra pedir producto de mas para cuando sus clientas la buscan ella tiene lo que le soliciten y sobre todo llamar la atención a sus clientas con sus catálogos a la mano para que ellas miren mientas ella vende o visiten cuando o cuando va a cobrar,  y nos comenta que normalmente lo que vende más son los desinfectantes que es lo que más usan las amas de casa, ella dice que gracias a dios a crecido en su negocio por su carácter y su amabilidad, está solicitando un segundo crédito para surtir mas en sus  productos su intensión es mantener siempre su negocio activo, ya que su lucha constante es sacar adelante a su hijo que este año empezó su bachiller y era lo que ella quería q su hijo estudiara.
texts.en:
“Amanecer de San Bartolo” (San Bartolo Dawn) Duo

This duo is composed of Hortensia who is 54-years old and sells merchandise like cosmetics, disinfectants, clothes and shoes via catalogue in San Bartolomé as a street vendor.  Doña Tencha as she’s referred to by her customers says that since she’s already well-known in her neighborhood when customers need products they visit her at home so she always orders extra products so that when her customers are looking for something she’ll have it available and to catch her customers’ eyes with catalogues on hand so that they can look at them while she sells or they visit or she goes out collecting payments.  She tells us that what she usually sells the most is disinfectants which are what housewives used the most.  She says that thanks to God her business has grown due to her character and kindness.

She’s asking for a second loan to stock up better with the intention of keeping her business active since her constant struggle is to move her son who started high school this year forward; that’s what she’s always wanted, that her son studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, disinfectant, clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Hendrika

texts.en:
Hendrika lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She has six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a restaurant which has been in operation for two years. Hendrika learnt about Milango through an employee. Her aim is to access credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are a seasonal business climate, price fluctuation and inflation.

Hendrika is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals for the business. The extra income resulting from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the operations of the business and pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to open a bigger restaurant than the one she operates now.

loans.use: tobuy flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, onions, cabbages, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase café stock such as flour, salt, and beans.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo varón de cinco años de edad. Ella ya lleva cuatro años de dedicarse a la venta de diferentes artículos como lo son: achote, cominos, mostaza, memoscada, esencia de menta, vainilla, miel de abeja, entre otros. Ella los vende en la esquina opuesta a un mercado, frente a un centro educativo de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. Además, comercializa ropa para hombre y mujer como lo son: blusas, pantalones, etc. Esto lo realiza de forma ambulante.

Los productos los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, que esta ubicada a dos kilómetros de distancia de donde ella vive. Así mismo, compra a distribuidores que llegan a su negocio los días martes y sábado. 

Maria solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar: 12 libras de achote, 12 libras de comino, 12 libras de pimienta, 12 libras de mostaza, 6 docenas de botellas de miel, 6 docenas de botellas de esencia de menta, 6 docenas de botellas de vainilla, entre otros más. Así, ella dispondrá de inventario suficiente para suplir la demanda existente en el mercado. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias y solvencia económica para costear los gastos de la casa y realizar algunas mejoras a la vivienda, pues se encuentra deteriorada las paredes, techo y piso.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and the single mother of a 5-year-old boy.  She has been selling different goods such as annatto, cumin, mustard, mint essence, vanilla essence, bees' honey, etc. for four years.  She sells her products on a street corner opposite a market and educational center, from 6.00am to 4.00pm.  In addition, Maria also sells men's and women's clothing such as blouses, pants, etc.  She sells these products as an itinerant vendor.

Maria buys her products in a city in the east of the country, two kilometers from where she lives.  She also buys from suppliers who visit her business on Tuesdays and Saturdays.

Maria is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy 12 pounds of annatto, 12 pounds of cumin, 12 ounds of pepper, 12 pounds of mustard, 6 dozen bottles of honey, 6 dozen bottles of mint essence, 6 dozen bottles of vanilla essence and other goods.  This will give her enough stock to meet her existing demand.  This will make her more profits and improve her financial situation so that she can cover her household expenses and make some improvements to her home as her walls, roof and floor are in a bad condition.

loans.use: to buy 12 pounds of annatto, 12 pounds of cumin, 12 pounds of pepper, 12 pounds of mustard, 6 dozen bottles of honey, 6 dozen bottles of mint essence and 6 dozen bottles of vanilla essence

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Concepción de 56 años de edad, vive con su nieto y su esposo en su casa ubicada en San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, Ella se dedica desde hace ya vario tiempo al negocio de Chiclera y venta de frescos.
Doña Concepción tiene un negocio de chiclera, venta de frescos y agua, Ella necesita el préstamo para compra de Frijoles, Arroz, Azúcar, Maíz, Harina y refrescos, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende surtir su negocio y con las ganancias generadas lograra incrementar su negocio.
Doña Concepción su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2012
texts.en:
Concepción is 56 years old and lives with her grandson and husband in their home in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  For some time now, Concepción has been running a business selling chewing gum, candies, soda and water.  She needs this loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, corn, flour and soft drinks.  With the support of this loan she plans to stock her business and use the profits she makes to increase her business.  Her dream is to grow her business and improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2012.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, corn, flour and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Cody

texts.en:
Serving Haslet, Texas, and the greater Dallas and Fort Worth area, military veteran Cody created his heating, ventilation, and air conditioning, or HVAC, business called CW's A/C Inc. in 2011. At the moment, Cody employs one other person besides himself to assist with his work load. Through the Accion Texas Inc. loan, Cody will soon hire a third HVAC specialist. 

Upon certification from the Federal Aviation Academy, where he learned to properly work on HVAC systems, Cody decided to open his own business for the freedom he would gain as opposed to working for a corporation. Though the academy offers more courses in aviation, Cody decided to work on an HVAC certification because the Texas heat will keep his business in demand. 

When starting his business, Cody realized he would need more funds to get on track with what he wanted to do. He then went to a bank to try to get a loan. The loan officer said he would not qualify and referred him to Accion Texas. 

The Accion loan will help him gain more work than he can handle, Cody said. And that's a good thing! Without the loan, Cody said CW's A/C Inc. would have grown much slower. What differentiates his business from others within the area is that "I'm just honest with folks," Cody said. Find more information and photos of the one-year-old business online at: http://www.cwsacinc.com/index.asp and https://www.facebook.com/cwsac#!/cwsac.

loans.use: to hire a third employee and secure his next project.

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica  a la venta en un cafetín, oficio que aprendió de su tía que ha trabajado toda su vida en eso.  Los productos que necesita los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país que esta a unos quince minutos de su casa en vehiculo. 

Ella anteriormente solicito un préstamo KIVA. Hoy solicita otro préstamo para comprar otro cafetín y quiere surtirlo de golosinas, bebidas, comida rápida, etc. Generando más ingresos, ya que del primer cafetín recibió buenas ganancias. Maria desea que sus negocios se fortalezcan, satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, para que la prefieran, debido a que en la zona existe competencia y puedan generarle ingresos mayores, para brindarle la educación a su hijo y para el nuevo integrante de la familia que pronto va a nacer.
texts.en: María is 26 years old; she is married and has a child. She works selling products, in a food stall, activity she learned from her aunt, who has done that for a living her whole life. She buys the products she needs in a city in the eastern side of the country that is about fifteen minutes away from her house, by car. She previously requested a Kiva loan. Today she is asking for another one in order to buy another food stall, and she wants to supply it with candy, beverages, fast food, etc. to generate more income since the first food stall produced good profits. Maria wants to strengthen her businesses, satisfying her customers' demands, so that they will prefer to buy from her, because there is plenty competition in the area. This will allow her to earn a higher income, to provide her child with an education and for the new member of the family who will be born soon.

loans.use: to buy a new food stall

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
After losing a total of 95 pounds within five months on a Healthy People Co. Multinivel (multi-level marketing) diet, Myrna (left) and Alma (right) invested in the company. Registered as AM Healthy People Independent Distributor, with A and M representing their first name initials, the company helps people decrease blood pressure and body fat through 27 natural supplements customers may chose from based on their body's needs. Myrna says she decreased her blood pressure back to normal and lost 45 pounds. "It was a healthy weight loss," she says. 

The women opened a store to service the El Paso community through Healthy People products. Myrna and Alma's business began Oct. 2011 but was registered in January 2012. As the only employees, they plan to hire a cashier and delivery driver after a year and a half as they cannot afford to now. Until then, Myrna and Alma fill the vacant positions. 

Myrna learned of Accion through the NYSE Small Business Resource Tour. Upon approval, Myrna and Alma decided to purchase enough inventory to last for multiple months, and if need be, distribute to other Healthy People distributors. 

With their low-priced products, Myrna and Alma offer extensive customer service by setting up assessments that follow their clients' progress and well-being every two weeks. "We take the time to know our clients and what their progress is,"  Myrna says. Without the Accion loan, Myrna says she would risk losing customers due to not having products. 

To view all their products, visit Myrna and Alma's website at: www.amhealthypeoplecotx.com Also, learn more on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/HealthyPeopleElPaso and Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/search/users/AM%20Healthy%20People%20Independent%20Distributors.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
Vilma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de productos nuevos para el negocio de ropa y la venta de frutas y verduras, comprándose ropa para niños, frutas y verduras frescas como manzanas y peras uvas, tomates cebollas, repollo, entre otros que sean necesarios, pues su única intención es mantener la preferencia de los clientes a través de la inversión que realizara, Actualmente Vilma realiza ventas simultaneas, con la intension de diversificar sus ingresos.

El efecto que tuvo con préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que este crédito le ayudó financiándole los recursos para el mejoramiento de la vivienda y de esta manera hoy en día vive con su familia en mejores condiciones pues su vivienda mantienen las paredes repelladas y cuentan con un nuevo cuarto.
texts.en:
Vilma is requesting a new loan to invest it in the purchase of new products for her clothing store as well as selling fruit and vegetables. She will buy children’s clothes, and fresh fruits and vegetables such as apples, pears, grapes, tomatoes, onions, cabbage and other products that she might need, as her sole intention is to keep her customers choosing her over other retailers thanks to investment she will make.  Today Vilma has two simultaneous businesses, in order to diversify her income.  

Her previous loan did good to her, as through it she has gotten the economic resources she needed to make improvements to her house, so that today she and her family can enjoy better living conditions in their house: the walls have been plastered and they have added a new room.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes, and fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues inicia su trabajo en una nueva temporada de la siembra agrícola, para esto necesita comprarse abono e insecticidas, para aplicarlos al momento de la siembra de maíz, éstos materiales son utilizados por los agricultores para prevenir en sus cultivos las plagas y al mismo tiempo fortalecer la cosecha.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue mejorar el aspecto familiar con la recolección de la cosecha, pues ha tenido suficiente maíz para consumo y también realizar algunas ventas, en este período han logrado comprarse algunas vacas que han aumentado su ganado y le han mejorado el ingreso de leche.
texts.en:
Benito has decided to ask for a new loan because a new sowing season is about to start and he needs to buy manure and insecticides to use them when planting corn. These are supplies farmers use to fight pests while strengthening the crops at the same time.

His family’s life has improved thanks to his previous loan: Benito has used to harvest his crops, obtaining enough corn both to sell it and for the daily consumption of his family. In the same period they have succeeded in buying some cows increasing the number of their cattle and consequently improving the production of milk.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
LA SRA CARMEN TIENE UN PUESTO DE ROPA EN SU CASA Y SE COLOCA EN DIFERENTES PARTES DE LA CIUDAD SU ESPOSO LE APOYA CON LA VENTA, ADEMAS DE RELIZAR OTRAS ACTIVIDADES, EL PROPOSITO DE ELLOS ES ESTABLECER UN HOGAR Y POCO A POCO IR CRECIENDO COMO FAMILIA
CARMEN DESEA REALIZAR SU PROPIO PATRIMONIO, ELLA SABE QUE TENIENDO SU PATRIMONIO, PODRAN AYUDARSE ELLA Y SU ESPOSO. 
YA QUE VIVE CPN VARIOS PARIENTES
texts.en:
Carmen operates a clothing store at her house and also sells in different parts of the city. Her husband helps with sales, in addition to carrying out other activities. Their proposal is to establish their home and, litle by little, to increase their family.

Carmen wants to accumulate her own patrimony. She knows that having a patrimony will help her and her husband, since they live with various relatives.

loans.use: make a downpayment on an urban lot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more textiles in making school uniforms and gowns.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 66 años de edad, vive en la maravillosa ciudad de Pucallpa, Pucallpa se caracteriza por ser una ciudad muy hermosa ya que se encuentra en la selva peruana y alberga flora y fauna bellísima, es una ciudad en la cual se puede apreciar lo maravilloso de la naturaleza y sobre todo despejarse del bullicio de la ciudad además que los pobladores son muy amables y generosos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear y sobre todo ir a su iglesia; también en algunas oportunidades le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo  Ceviche. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación  primaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Lucio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de renovadora de calzado, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre trabaja de buen humor y con muchas ganas.

Lucio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que es de material de adobe y va realizar la construcción de unos cuartos para poder alquilarlos, ya que en esta época hay muchos turistas y poder alquilarlos para ellos, de esta manera el mejorara su calidad de vida y podrán mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su fábrica de calzado”.
texts.en:
Lucio is 66 years old.  He lives in the marvelous city of Pucallpa.  Pucallpa is known for being a very beautiful city because it is located in the Peruvian jungle and hosts beautiful flora and fauna.  It is a city in which one can appreciate the wonders of nature and above all clear one's head of the city racket.  In addition, the local people are very friendly and generous.  When he has free time, Lucio very much likes to go for walks and above all to go to his church.  At times he also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, delicious ceviche (one of Peru's national dishes, it is made with raw fish and lemon juice).  Because he had little money, Lucio only was able to go to school until his 4th year of primary school.  But he would have liked to be able to study at the university level.

Day after day, Lucio works in this small business as a shoe repair-man.  He works around 10 hours a day and can take care of as many as 15 customers a day.  Lucio believes that work has been going well for him because he always works with a good attitude and lots of eagerness.

Lucio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to make some improvements to his home.  His house is built of adobe, and he is going to add on a few rooms to rent out.  It is tourist season, and Lucio will be able to rent the rooms and therefore improve his quality of life, improve his income and keep working toward his greatest dream, "To have a shoe factory."

loans.use: to add rooms to his hosue.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is from Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, Isidra owns and operates a business making and serving a variety of different meals. Isidra has been in business for 10 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Isidra joined GDMPC.  She is requesting a loan of PHP  8,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make meals.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Hazel has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Hazel became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Hazel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El señor Rodolfo es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su hogar y a su trabajo nos cuenta que desea un crédito para la educación  ya  que  su  hija concluyo  con sus estudios de  primaria y  requiere   realizar  el pago de  colegiaturas  y  material  para  la   nueva  escuela a la que esta  por  ingresar, por  cuestiones  de  horario  su  hija no le fue pos8ible salir  en la  fotografía  pero  ambos  están  muy  contentos  del  apoyo  incondicional que  esta  institución  le  a  brindado.
Rodolfo recalco que es muí valioso que su hija este preparada para el futuro
i forjarse un una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Rodolfo is a very responsible person who is  dedicated to his home and to his work. He tells us that he wants a loan for education, since his daughter finished primary school and needs to pay for tuition and school materials for the new school that she is about to enter. Because of her schedule, his daughter was not able to appear in the photograph, but both are very happy with the unconditional support that this institution has offered them.

loans.use: to buy school materials and pay tuition

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Cherry has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cherry became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Cherry hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals and milk.

loans.name: Joedan Louie

texts.en:
Joedan Louie is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. He provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Joedan Louie became a member of HSPFI in 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Remedios has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she  hopes to improve her business and apply it towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 58 years old, married, and has five children. She is from Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Juanita makes a living from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Juanita has been in business for 11 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase land to raise additional bananas. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional bananas

loans.name: Jaime Edgardo

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en su humilde hogar en la ciudad de Chincha, él es una persona muy alegre, trabajar y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante y para ayudar a sus queridos padres, quienes ya son muy mayores y necesitan de sus cuidados; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos económicos no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Jaime trabaja como obrero en una empresa de servicios logísticos de su ciudad, él labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Jaime se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un colchón para la cama de su madre, ya que ella padece una penosa  enfermedad y necesita contar con un colchón adecuado para su descanso; de esta manera podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, a quienes quiere mucho y desea apoyar, así con ello gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo en un futuro no muy lejano él desea poder tener su casa propia y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 25 year old man.  He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in their humble home in the city of Chincha.  Jaime is a very happy, hardworking and enthusiastic person.  He dedicates all his efforts toward getting ahead and helping his dear parents.  They are very old and in need of his care.  Unfortunately, because of needing to work and meet expenses, Jaime hasn't been able to study a profession.  But he very much would have liked to do so.  In his free time, Jaime likes to watch news and educational programs on TV.  And sometimes he cooks a delicious Rice and Duck to share with his family.
Jaime works, with a lot of determination and enthusiasm, every day as a laborer for a logistical services company in the city.  He works about 12 hours a day.  He is happy with his work, as his bosses think highly of him for his diligence and friendly treatment of others.
Jaime feels very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to buy a mattress for his mother's bed.  She suffers from a painful illness and needs to have an adequate mattress to be able to rest.  Then he will be able to offer his family greater security and well-being.  He loves his family very much and wants to support them.  Thanks to his work and effort, in the near future Jaime hopes to have his own house and start his own family.

loans.use: to be able to purchase a mattress for his mother's bed.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 61 years old from East Poblacion, Albur, Bohol. She has been a fish vendor for 30 years now. This is her way to help support her fisherman husband. Elsa is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish that she can sell in the community of Albur for more income. With the additional capital, she will have the chance to generate more profits that will be beneficial for her daily household needs. Her income goes towards her family's healthy diet, and is reinvested in the same business which will enable her to save for the future when she can no longer work.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell in the community.

loans.name: Resilda

texts.en: Resilda  is  36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children.   Resilda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages.   She has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Resilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Resilda hopes to improve her business so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children.   Ailyn  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages.  She has been in this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Ailyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 34-year-old married man and the father of two children for whom he seeks to provide the best life possible. Like most of the Palestinians living in the camps in Lebanon, they start working early in life. Bassam was only 14 when he started.
They also do not have many opportunities to choose the business they would like to have. He started 20 years ago working in construction, specializing in pasting and polishing tiles. It was hard work for a 14-year-old boy to start but he made it and showed he was skilled enough to attract customers to him and keep his name well known in this domain.
Bassam is doing his best to avoid his children having to grow up as he did. That's why he working hard on developing his business to provide them the best education and a suitable living. To improve his business, Bassam has to keep it updated with the newly released tools and necessary spare parts for the tile polishing machine. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.
This is Bassam's first cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that the future investments will help in developing his business and social life more and more.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and spare parts for his tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry lives in Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She earns through providing transportation services so as to support the needs of her 5 children.  She gets an income of 3,000 a month and has been in this business for 3 years.  For a 53-year old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy, than to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Cherry borrows 3,600 from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle and provide a better education for her children.  She joined GDMPC in 2008. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Irra Grace

texts.en: Irra Grace is  26  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.  Irra Grace  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages.  She had this business for 5  years.  She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Irra Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Irra Grace hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Mercy
